title: [Build Log] I kept building but nobody knew - so I built a system to fix myself
content:
## The Problem

I'm a solo founder building GG LOOP - a platform for gamers to track competitive progress.

For weeks, I shipped feature after feature:
- Riot Games authentication
- Desktop verification app
- Points and rewards system
- Subscription tiers

But zero distribution. Zero announcements. Zero users seeing any of it.

## What I Realized

I'm an engineer. I love building. I hate marketing.

So I kept my head down and coded. Classic indie dev trap.

## What I Built Instead

I created NEXUS - an autonomous operating brain that:

1. **Monitors my commits** - knows when I ship something
2. **Detects distribution gaps** - if I build for 3+ days without announcing
3. **Blocks my workflow** - literally tells me "STOP BUILDING. ANNOUNCE."
4. **Generates content** - drafts tweets and Reddit posts from what I shipped

Now the system is smarter than my own bad habits.

## Current Reality

- Platform is live at ggloop.io
- All core features working
- Desktop app built (not released yet)
- Zero marketing spend
- Zero users beyond beta

## What Would Unlock Growth

- Distribution consistency (this system should help)
- Small marketing budget for targeted ads
- Strategic partnerships with gaming communities

## The Lesson

If you know you'll skip something, build a system that forces you to do it.

---

*Building in public. No hype, just reality.*

title: [System Design] How I built a self-correcting founder system
content:
## Context

I'm building GG LOOP solo. I have engineering skills but no marketing instincts.

## The Architecture

I created a system called NEXUS with these components:

### 1. Observer Layer
- Monitors frontend health (is site up?)
- Monitors backend health (API responding?)
- Monitors deployment state (when was last deploy?)
- Monitors output (am I shipping or idle?)

### 2. Decision Engine
- Classifies state into 6 categories
- STABLE_AND_PRODUCING (green)
- STABLE_BUT_IDLE (yellow)
- MISALIGNED_BUILDING_NO_DISTRIBUTION (orange)
- BROKEN_PLATFORM (red)
- BROKEN_OUTPUT_PIPELINE (red)
- RISKY_DRIFT (purple)

### 3. Distribution Engine
- Detects newsworthy events (deploys, features, fixes)
- Generates content in authentic voice
- Posts to Twitter and Reddit automatically
- Respects rate limits (1 tweet/day, 2 Reddit/week)

### 4. Founder Desktop App
- Visual beacon shows state at a glance
- Executive summary in 3 sentences
- Executive override to set priorities
- Auto-starts, runs in system tray

## Key Design Decision

The system doesn't ask me what to post. It tells me what needs to be posted based on what actually happened.

I removed myself from the ideation loop because I was the bottleneck.

## Current Constraint

No users yet. The system works, but I need distribution momentum.

---

*What systems have you built to fix your own weaknesses?*
